body: errors in javascript are tricky and extending them is tricky as well. Note sure if should continue extending error classes.

But there are already so many here. https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/tree/master/src/error
I have read this https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1382107/whats-a-good-way-to-extend-error-in-javascript
There are too many versions of browsers, but you still can support the target node first, right?

> Note sure if should continue extending error classes.

@pleerock Any other good way to achieve what we want without extending error classes?

This is a fantastic idea. @pleerock can you explain why this would be a problem in Typescript? I'm a recent Java transplant so some of the Ts => Js issues don't make sense yet. But when I learned that there wasn't a super class of `TypescriptError` I was disappointed. It would make good error handling so much cleaner.

> This is a fantastic idea. @pleerock can you explain why this would be a problem in Typescript? I'm a recent Java transplant so some of the Ts => Js issues don't make sense yet. But when I learned that there wasn't a super class of `TypescriptError` I was disappointed. It would make good error handling so much cleaner.

Did you mean TypeOrmError? TypescriptError doesn't seem to make any sense to me.

issue.title: refactor: create base error and simplify error creation

repository.name: typeorm
repository.description: ORM for TypeScript and JavaScript. Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, SQLite, MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP Hana, WebSQL databases. Works in NodeJS, Browser, Ionic, Cordova and Electron platforms.

issue.body:
This creates a base TypeORM Error that follows the conventions needed to fix the prototype tree & allow hierarchical error trees 

fixes #3479

issue.title: Export error types for checks on the outside

repository.name: typeorm
repository.description: ORM for TypeScript and JavaScript. Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, SQLite, MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP Hana, WebSQL databases. Works in NodeJS, Browser, Ionic, Cordova and Electron platforms.

issue.body:
## Feature Description

### The Problem

<!--
  A clear and concise description of what the problem is, and
  why it needs to be implemented as a new feature for TypeORM.

  For example, "I'm always frustrated when ..."

  Why should this be a part of TypeORM?
-->
We use NestJS with the TypeOrm integration and try to catch TypeOrm errors with a NestJs-Filter. Unfortunatley only the `QueryFailedError` is exported from the TypeOrm-Library. This stops us from being able to check something like `error instanceOf EntityNotFoundError`. Worse, we cannot specify this error as part of the `Catch` clause from NestJS.

### The Solution

<!--
  A clear and concise description of what you want to happen.

  How can the requested feature be used to approach the problem it's supposed to solve?
-->
Export all errrors. 


### Are you willing to resolve this issue by submitting a Pull Request?

- [x] Yes, I have the time, and I know how to start.
- [ ] Yes, I have the time, but I don't know how to start. I would need guidance.
- [ ] No, I don't have the time, although I believe I could do it if I had the time...
- [ ] No, I don't have the time and I wouldn't even know how to start.


<!--
   Have a great day and thank you for the feature request!
-->
